page.title: 07Jaxons Farm, Whitminster.
page.content:
Continued from page 6.
On the farm they keep a Gloucester Old Spot pig. The main ingredient of the famous Gloucester sausage. Unfortunately people don't like the pigs spots so the piglets have to be sold to friends rather than the market.
One of the fields is sown with a ley of clover and grass for the cattle to eat as this provides good fodder.
The ground on the farm is very heavy clay and drains badly so is not really suitable for arable crops.
Much of the local land is no longer owned by local people but has been bought by people from outside.
